Clustering with scipyÂ¶

This example is adapted from mdtraj

In [1]: from __future__ import print_function

In [2]: import matplotlib

In [3]: import pytraj as pt

In [4]: import scipy

In [5]: import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

In [6]: import scipy.cluster.hierarchy

# load data
In [7]: traj = pt.iterload('data/tz2.ortho.nc', 'data/tz2.ortho.parm7')

In [8]: traj
Out[8]: 
<pytraj.TrajectoryIterator, 10 frames, include:
<Topology: 5293 atoms, 1704 residues, 1692 mols, PBC with box type = ortho>>
           

# calculate pairwise rmsd with `autoimage=True`
# generally we only need to cluster a subset of atoms.
# in this example, we chose 'CA' atoms
In [9]: distances = pt.pairwise_rmsd(traj(mask='@CA', autoimage=True))

# use `scipy` to perform clustering
In [10]: linkage = scipy.cluster.hierarchy.ward(distances)

In [11]: scipy.cluster.hierarchy.dendrogram(linkage, no_labels=True, count_sort='descendent')
Out[11]:
